title: Illustrated type
content:
Apologies for asking this again, but I can't think of the name of the guy who does  
beautifully illustrated type – I think it was used in a Casio advert a short while ago.  
It's hard to describe, apart from a sans serif type with swirls and tendrils coming  
out of it.

I'd appreciate anyone helping me out here, words are failing me...
author: wordsfailme

comments.content: Brilliant! A prize of an Easter egg is yours, if only I knew where to send it.

Give it to the Bunny, he’ll know where I am.

Tim
Beware how MASSIVELY overused this effect is right now.

Patty, it's Easter, loads of people are giving eggs, still effective though :)

Tim

_I know what you mean, every Christmas identity had a take on that style_

Alvy Singer: It was great seeing Annie again and I realized what a terrific person she was and how much fun it was just knowing her and I thought of that old joke, you know, the, this, this guy goes to a psychiatrist and says, 'Doc, uh, my brother's crazy, he thinks he's a chicken,' and uh, the doctor says, 'well why don't you turn him in?' And the guy says, 'I would, but I need the eggs.' Well, I guess that's pretty much now how I feel about relationships. You know, they're totally irrational and crazy and absurd and, but uh, I guess we keep going through it...because...most of us need the eggs.

Of course, this was a man who thought the only difference between LA and NYC was that LA lets you make a right-hand turn on a red light. ;-)

Great movie....
